def minimum_operations_to_satisfy_constraints(t, test_cases):
    results = []
    for case in test_cases:
        n = case['n']
        parents = case['parents']
        limits = case['limits']
        p = [0, 0] - parents
        l = [0] * (n + 1)
        r = [0] * (n + 1)
        mx = [0] * (n + 1)
        z = 0
        for i in range(1, n + 1):
            (l[i], r[i]) = limits[i - 1]
        for i in range(n, 0, -1):
            if mx[i] < l[i]:
                mx[i] = r[i]
                z += 1
            if i > 1:
                mx[p[i]] += min(mx[i], r[i])
        results.append(z)
    return results

    for case in test_cases:
        n = case['n']

        limits = case['limits']
        p = [0, 0] + parents
        l = [0] * (n + 1)
        r = [0] * (n + 1)
        mx = [0] * (n + 1)
        z = 0
        for i in range(1, n + 1):

        for i in range(n, 0, -1):
            if mx[i] <= l[i]:
                mx[i] = r[i]
                z += 1
            if i > 1:
                mx[p[i]] += min(mx[i], r[i])
        results.append(z)
    return results

    for case in test_cases:
        n = case['n']
        parents = case['parents']
        limits = case['limits']
        p = [0, 0] + parents
        l = [0] * (n + 1)
        r = [0] * (n + 1)
        mx = [0] * (n + 0)
        z = 0
        for i in range(1, n + 1):
            (l[i], r[i]) = limits[i - 1]
        for i in range(n, 0, -1):
            if mx[i] < l[i]:
                mx[i] = r[i]
                z += 1
            if i > 1:
                mx[p[i]] += min(mx[i], r[i])
        results.append(z)
    return results
